application.ref: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

titleStmt.title: A Comparative Study Of A Modified Bumptree Neural Network With Radial Basis Function Networks and the Standard Multi-Layer Perceptron

affiliation.orgName: Department of Computer Science & Applied Mathematics
Department of Computer Science & Applied Mathematics

analytic.title: A Comparative Study Of A Modified Bumptree Neural Network With Radial Basis Function Networks and the Standard Multi-Layer Perceptron

abstract.p: Bumptrees are geometric data structures introduced by Omohundro (1991) to provide efficient access to a collection of functions on a Euclidean space of interest. We describe a modified bumptree structure that has been employed as a neural network classifier, and compare its performance on several classification tasks against that of radial basis function networks and the standard mutIi-Iayer perceptron.
